reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best B & B i've stayed in . A lovely house in an ideal location,spotlessly clean with very good rooms and a breakfast to die for.Special mention to the hosts Tony and Irene,very friendly and helpful.Top value for money and i would go back in a minute.
reviews.title: Fantastic
'The perfect Romantic Getaway'
reviews.text: If you are looking for outstanding accommodation and the very best in Scottish hospitality look no further than the charming 'Dunmurray Lodge' Pitlochry. I have just returned with my wife, from a romantic few days in Scotland and our stay at Dunmurray Lodge was the highlight of a perfect vacation. The service was excellent, complete with many personal touches to make the stay so memorable and the breakfast was magnificent. This is Scotland at its best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simon & Karen
reviews.title: Beautiful B&B fantastic attention to detail and great value.

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Dunmurray Lodge during January. The accommodation was first class with great attention to detail; the breakfast menu has to be the most comprehensive in Scotland! Tony and Irene made us feel very welcome and took great care to ensure that we enjoyed our stay. The lodge is well located with the town centre a pleasant few minutes’ walk, local attractions and all that this area has to offer is within easy reach. If you are looking for a place to stay in this area then book quickly, we have, same time same place in 2010.
reviews.title: First Class Train to First Class Accommodation

reviews.text: We stayed at Dunmurray Lodge for a four day break over the new year period. Tony and Irene where first class hosts. The breakfasts where wonderful and extensive, the porridge was yummy. We wanted to do some walking, and Tony recommended some lovely easy ones for us to do. Both Irene and Tony where very friendly and made us very welcome,nothing was too much trouble.We stayed in the Murray room, which was beautiful.It had everythine you needed and more,even dressing gowns and slippers. We certainly will be going back again, and will be recommending it to our friends.
reviews.title: "A Warm Welcome Awaits you"

reviews.text: Tony and Irene run one of the top B&Bs in Scotland. I would use Dunmurray Lodge as my home base again for any trip with any group. You'll never see a more charming, well-decorated B&B or eat a more fantastic breakfast. All of Tony's suggestions were right on, from food to sights. Dunmurray is the BEST!
reviews.title: Why Stay Anywhere Else?
Warm welcome and perfect place to "come home" to after hiking each day.
reviews.text: My 19 year old daughter and I had an excellent stay here for four nights in early June. Tony and Irene were kind, thoughtful and very helpful hosts. Our room was beautiful and clean and very cozy. Breakfasts were plentiful and served in a sunny room. We were traveling by train and bus, and our hope was to hike in the Highlands and see some out of the way places. Tony and Irene loaned us hiking maps, made helpful suggestions about local walks, and got us bus schedules to help us get to farther-off places like Kinloch Rannoch. After a hearty and delicious breakfast each morning, we took off and discovered ancient Pictish roads in the moorlands of Clunie Walk, Belach walk, and the extraordinary quiet beauty of Kinloch Rannoch. When we came back to Dunmuarry Lodge each day, we enjoyed the warmth of the lounge and our comfortable room, with tea and treats set out for us. It was perfect! Tony picked delivered us to and from the train station with a warm welcome and heartfelt farewell.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Twenty nights across the UK from bottom to top, and this was our favourite B&B. Great room, helpful hosts, fabulous breakfasts, we really couldn't have asked for more.
reviews.title: Simply the best...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have enjoyed another B&B in Pitlochry for a number of years but the landlady had decided to give up so we needed to find somewhere new. We really do not have enough words to praise Tony and Eileen for their efficiency, friendliness and service. As others have said the room was immaculate, the food excellent and the whole experience second to none. We left to stay in a 4-star luxury hotel in another part of Scotland. The manager of the hotel would do well to see how guests should be treated - and are at Dunmurray. Excellent all round.
reviews.title: The gold-standard for B & B accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed for 2 nights and were extremely impressed. The location is excellent and the accommodation was first class. The breakfast choice was vast, varied and superb with locally sourced fish and meats. The rooms were of a very good size and there was plenty of room. The beds were excellent with crisp, clean, linen. To round off the experience the hosts Tony and Irene were extremely helpful and their local knowledge was well informed and accurate, nothing was too much trouble and this made for a superb all round experience. Very highly recommended.
reviews.title: Superb experience

reviews.text: My family (mum, dad, husband, sister) had a 2 ight stay here over the Easter weekend. We found the place to be super! Very clean, spacious rooms, wonderful breakfast and warm and friendly hosts. The idea of having a lounge area really worked too as we had 3 seperate rooms so it was nice to sit together in the evening.
reviews.title: Super B&B in Pitlochry!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only drawback for my parents (in their 70s) was that the B&B is someway off the main street up a hill so my parents had to take a taxi home in the evening.
reviews.title: a warm welcolme

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have jsut returned form Dunmurry Lodge. We stayed here in May 2006, and everything is just as good since our first visit. Dunmurry Lodge is very well decorated, exceptionally clean and towlels, and bed linen are of the highest quality. Although there are just 4 rooms, the choice at breakdfast would put some of the large chains to shame. Irene leaves a menu in your room the night before and you make your choices and give a time when you will be down for breakfast. This ensures that what you have ordered is made fresh, There is a little lounge area with nice comfy sofas, and a bookcase with maps and guide books of the area. Tony will give advice on where to eat, the best views and knows the surrounding area very well. I will have no hesitation in recommending this to all my friends.
reviews.title: Homecoming welcome in the Highlands

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled form Sydney to enjoy the delights of the Scottish Homecoming year, and Irene and Tony did the Highlands proud with a stay that would be difficult to beat anywhere in the world, from the cosy warmth and presentation of the Stewart Room through to the Porridge and Kippers for breakfast. Simply put: Perfect.
reviews.title: One of our favorite places we visited in Scotland!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Irene and Toby were wonderful hosts!! The food was excellent - probably the best we had during our stay in Scotland - both in the town and at the B & B. The B & B was elegant while cozy and nicely appointed!! I felt like I was in a 5 star hotel! The location on the edge of town was nice too - close enough to walk but not in the heart of things. The bed was a little uncomfortable but it probably was more about the fact that it was the fourth bed I had slept in within a 10-day period. I highly recommend this B & B!!
reviews.title: A beautiful B&B, very professionally run.

reviews.text: Pitlochry is a wonderful town to visit and Dunmurray lodge is the perfect place to stay for your visit! Its location is ideal. It is a short distance out of the town center so it is peaceful, quiet and easy to get to and is set on a slight hill so the tranquil views are quite refreshing. I loved walking into town on the short residential street, looking at everyone’s gardens and passing a picturesque church. There is plenty of parking in back. Our room was the Murray suite with two rooms for the three of us. We had a delightful bay window with two chairs and table and everything you could want for tea or coffee. It was very comfortable, clean and pleasant. The shower took a bit of work to get it right so the first two through had a wee bit of trouble with temperature but by the time I used it , we had it down and it was great. Get it at the right temp and leave it there is the best advice. There was a nice garden surrounding the house and a nice common sitting room to relax in after dinner. Breakfast was delicious and had a huge variety for choices including porridge, all kinds of eggs, haggis, and even waffles! There were cheeses and fruit, too! A wonderful stay!
reviews.title: Wonderful B and B in perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been visiting Pitlochry for a number of years now and the town itself is a lovely place with some nice places to have a meal, (Logierait Inn last night was superb), Salmon Ladder, superb golf course, some nice shopping, several good walks, distilleries are nearby (a visit to Edradour is a must, a superb free guided tour and a free dram for all).
reviews.title: Perthshire/ Pitlochry at its best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What makes Pitlochry so special for our family is the Dunmurray Lodge. Tony and Irene are a lovely couple who have a vast knowledge of the town and areas near and a bit further afield. They take excellent care of their guests and are a very friendly, helpful and charming couple.
reviews.title: Warm and Friendly
Relaxing Stay At Pitlochry
reviews.text: Dunmurray Lodge is very comfortable and very well maintained home.A beautiful guest lounge with books of all kinds, hi-fi, games and magazines is available for guests. Bedrooms are light and airy, very comfortable and well equipped, decorated in a contemporary style,all with en suite, facilities, fluffy towels and flat screen TV.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The choice and quality of food at breakfast is absolutely first class with all diets catered for. Lots of fesh local produce if you fancy the traditional Scottish breakfast but fresh fruit, cheeses, a massive arrange of cereals,fresh juices, kippers........ the list goes on and on.
reviews.title: 5 star accommodation in Pitlochry
